intro: Pentameris triseta, commonly known as the three-branched pentameris, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a serrated edge. Pentameris triseta is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
